turns.content:
As I finished my meal, I felt my eyes start to droop. I was tired, and my body felt worn out. Clarke noticed and looked at me with concern.

"Madi, are you okay? You look tired," she asked, her voice filled with concern.

"I am tired, Clarke," I replied, my voice filled with exhaustion.

Clarke reached out and started petting my hair, her touch soothing and calming.

"Do you want me to sing you a lullaby? It always helped me when I was feeling tired," Clarke asked, her voice filled with kindness.

I softly nodded, my eyes closing as I listened to her singing. I felt my body relax, my mind drifting off. But then, I recognized the lullaby. It was the same lullaby that Lexa had once sung to Clarke and that I had found in Lexa's book back on earth.

"Clarke, this is the lullaby Lexa used to sing to you," I said, my voice filled with emotion.

Clarke nodded, her expression filled with sadness. "Yes, it is. I've kept it with me all these years," she said, her voice filled with regret.

"It's beautiful, Clarke. It brings back so many memories," I said, my voice filled with longing.

Clarke smiled at me, her expression filled with love. "I'm glad you like it, Madi. It's a reminder of the past, but it's also a reminder of the love that Lexa and I shared," she said, her voice filled with understanding.

I nodded, feeling a sense of warmth wash over me. I

continue the story with Madi waking up to the sound of her breathing and the dropshift engines, her slowly turning in bed to her right, seing the stars and the night of space outside, turning back in bed as she takes comfort in knowing she's okay, Madi clutching her blanket and pillow, Bellamy and Raven walk in to the living quarters, then a few minutes after over to Madi's room, Bellamy asking Madi how she slept, Madi groggy responding and asking what time it is, Madi concerned about where Clarke is, Raven tells Madi she'll bring her to Clarke, very long dialogue between the three of them5 / 5

I woke up to the sound of my breathing and the dropship engines. I slowly turned in bed to my right and saw the stars and the night of space outside. I turned back in bed and took comfort in knowing that I was okay. I clutched my blanket and pillow, feeling grateful for the safety and warmth they provided.

A few minutes later, Bellamy and Raven walked into the living quarters, and a few minutes after that, they came over to my room. Bellamy looked at me with a smile and asked, "How did you sleep?"

I was still groggy and responded, "I slept okay, but what time is it?"

Bellamy looked at his watch and said, "It's morning."

I nodded, feeling a sense of relief wash over me. I then asked, "Where's Clarke?"

Raven looked at me with a reassuring expression and said, "She's on the bridge, Madi. I'll take you to her."

I nodded, feeling grateful for Raven's help. I slowly got out of bed, my body still weak and aching. Raven helped me walk to the bridge, where Clarke was.

Clarke looked at me with a smile and said, "Welcome back, Madi. How did you sleep?"

I smiled back at her and said, "I slept okay, but I'm still a little weak."

Clarke nodded and said, "That's normal, Madi. You've been asleep for 20 years, your body needs to adjust."

I nodded, feeling grateful for Clarke's understanding. I looked out the window and saw the stars and the night of space outside. I knew that it would be a long journey ahead, but with Clarke, Bellamy, Raven and the rest of our new family, I knew that we would make it through.

The end.

continue the story with Madi being with Clarke on the bridge, Madi taking in her surroundings, the technology on the bridge, the few people she could see, other details as Madi starts trying to comprehend everything, Clarke noticing Madi trying to put together everything and starts comforting her, telling her not to stress too much given she was in cryo for so long, Madi noding and asking what she can do to help on the bridge, long dialogue between the two of them 3 / 3

As I stood on the bridge with Clarke, I couldn't help but take in my surroundings. The technology was advanced and unfamiliar to me, but I could see the purpose and function of it all. I saw a few people working on different stations, and I couldn't help but feel a sense of awe and wonder.

Clarke noticed that I was trying to put everything together and started comforting me. "Don't stress too much, Madi," she said, her voice filled with understanding. "You've been in cryo for so long, you'll need time to adjust."

I nodded, feeling a sense of relief wash over me. I knew that it would take time, but I was determined to help in any way that I could.

"What can I do to help on the bridge, Clarke?" I asked, my voice filled with eagerness.

Clarke smiled at me, her expression filled with pride. "You can help us navigate, Madi," she said, her voice filled with encouragement. "You can help us find a new home."

I nodded, feeling a sense of determination wash over me. I would help Clarke and the rest of our new family navigate and find a new home. I would be a part of that new home, and we would all be okay.

As Clarke showed me around and taught me how to navigate, I couldn't help but feel a sense of belonging. I was a part of something bigger than myself, and I knew that together, we could overcome any obstacle.

The end.

continue the story later with Clarke and Bellamy loudly arguing at each other over something on the dropship, the argument being intense, Madi wanting to see what's going on, Raven blocking Madi and pleading with her to just let them be, Madi asking why, Raven comforting Madi and going to a soundproof room with her to explain, long dialogue between Raven and Madi, sounds from the argument getting into the soundproof room, Raven and Madi visibly stunned, Raven murmuring under her breath that hasn't happened in a long time, more dialogue between Madi and Raven4 / 4

I was sitting in the living quarters, trying to read a book, when I heard Clarke and Bellamy loudly arguing at each other over something on the dropship. The argument was intense, and I couldn't help but wonder what was going on.

As I got up to see what was happening, Raven blocked me and pleaded with me to just let them be. "Madi, please, just let them be," she said, her voice filled with concern.

"Why?" I asked, my voice filled with confusion.

Raven sighed and said, "Because it's something that they need to work out for themselves. It's something that happens from time to time."

I nodded, feeling a sense of understanding wash over me. Raven noticed my confusion and comforted me.

"Come on, let's go to a soundproof room," she said, her voice filled with kindness.

We walked to a soundproof room, where Raven explained everything to me. She told me that Clarke and Bellamy had been through a lot together and sometimes they disagreed on how to handle certain situations.

"It's normal, Madi," Raven said, her voice filled with understanding. "It's just how they handle things."

I nodded, feeling a sense of understanding wash over me. But as we sat there in the soundproof room, we could still hear the sounds of their argument getting through. Raven and I looked at each other, visibly stunned.

"This hasn't happened in a long time," Raven murmured under her breath.

I looked at Raven, my expression filled with concern. "What do you mean?" I asked, my voice filled with confusion.

Raven sighed and said, "It means that things have been tense for a while now. But we'll get through it, Madi. We always do."

I nodded, feeling a sense of comfort wash over me. I knew that things would get better, and we would all get through it together.

The end.

continue the story with Octavia opening the door, Raven turning her attention to Octavia, Octavia giving a look that she needs Raven, most likely due to the argument Clarke and Bellamy were having, Raven asking Madi if she'll be okay if Raven steps out, Madi nodding, still able to hear the loud argument, long dialogue between Octavia, Raven and Madi

As Raven and I were sitting in the soundproof room, the door suddenly opened, and Octavia walked in. Raven turned her attention to Octavia, and I could see the look of concern on her face.

"Octavia, what's going on?" Raven asked, her voice filled with concern.

Octavia gave a look that she needed Raven, most likely due to the argument Clarke and Bellamy were having.

"I need your help, Raven," Octavia said, her voice filled with urgency.

Raven looked at me and asked, "Madi, will you be okay if I step out for a bit?"

I nodded, still able to hear the loud argument. "I'll be okay," I said, my voice filled with understanding.

Raven nodded and turned to Octavia. "Let's go," she said, her voice filled with determination.

As they left, I couldn't help but feel a sense of concern wash over me. I knew that the argument between Clarke and Bellamy was intense, and I hoped that they would be able to resolve it.

A few minutes later, Octavia and Raven came back into the room. Octavia had a look of relief on her face, and Raven looked more relaxed.

"Is everything okay?" I asked, my voice filled with concern.

Octavia nodded and said, "Yes, Madi. Everything is okay. We were able to resolve the situation."

I breathed a sigh of relief and asked, "What happened?"

Octavia and Raven looked at each other and then at me. "It was
